te_po.routes.vector.doc: Run a simple retrieval against stored embeddings for confidence checks.
te_po.routes.vector.name: vector_retrieval_test

te_po.routes.vector.doc:
Return recent vector logs saved locally (te_po/storage/openai/<glyph>.json).
    Useful for UI 'recent vectors' display.
te_po.routes.vector.name: vector_recent

te_po.routes.vector.doc: Check the status of a vector store file batch (GA OpenAI API).

query_params.name: batch_id
query_params.description: OpenAI vector store file batch id

query_params.name: vector_store_id
query_params.description: Override vector store id; defaults to OPENAI_VECTOR_STORE_ID env

te_po.routes.vector.name: vector_batch_status

te_po.routes.status.doc: Lightweight health endpoint for Te Pō.
te_po.routes.status.name: status

te_po.routes.status.doc: Check OpenAI readiness (key present, optional vector store reachable).
te_po.routes.status.name: status_openai

te_po.routes.ocr.doc:
Direct StealthOCR test endpoint using real Tesseract + vision fallback (with cultural protection).
    Returns the protected text and metadata; does NOT run the full pipeline.
te_po.routes.ocr.name: stealth_scan

te_po.routes.ocr.doc:
Alternate StealthOCR test endpoint using the testit class (real Tesseract + vision).
    Useful to compare behaviors without touching the main pipeline.
te_po.routes.ocr.name: stealth_scan_testit

te_po.routes.research.doc: Web search via Brave API with optional site filters. Falls back to stacked search if missing key, empty, or failure.
te_po.routes.research.name: research_web_search

te_po.routes.research.doc: Layered research: local vector search -> recent docs -> web/LLM fallback.
te_po.routes.research.name: research_stacked

te_po.routes.dev.doc: Quick chat endpoint for the local Ollama (Llama 3) runtime.

fields.name: system_prompt
fields.default: You are a helpful Māori research assistant.

te_po.routes.dev.name: dev_ollama

te_po.routes.dev.doc: List all registered routes in the application.
te_po.routes.dev.name: list_routes

te_po.routes.pipeline.doc: Run the pipeline on an uploaded file (preferred) or inline text.
te_po.routes.pipeline.name: pipeline_run

te_po.routes.pipeline.doc:
Enqueue a pipeline job (inline mode) or to Redis/RQ (RQ mode).
    
    Queue mode controlled by QUEUE_MODE env var:
    - inline (default): Run immediately in-process, no Redis required
    - rq: Use Redis queue, requires Redis configured
    
    Returns:
    - Inline mode: {job_id, status, result?, error?}
    - RQ mode: {job_id, rq_job_id, queue, realm, status}
    
    Optional header: X-Realm (for multi-tenant tracking)
te_po.routes.pipeline.name: enqueue_pipeline

te_po.routes.pipeline.doc:
Return the pipeline job status from PostgreSQL (durable tracking).
    
    Includes: status, result, error, started_at, finished_at, queue, realm.
    Falls back to Supabase if PostgreSQL unavailable (backward compat).
te_po.routes.pipeline.name: pipeline_status

te_po.routes.pipeline.doc:
Get recent pipeline jobs from PostgreSQL for dashboarding.
    
    Query parameters:
    - limit: Max results (default 50, max 500)
    - realm: Filter by realm (optional)
    - queue: Filter by queue (urgent/default/slow) (optional)
    - status: Filter by status (queued/running/finished/failed) (optional)
te_po.routes.pipeline.name: get_recent_jobs_endpoint

te_po.routes.pipeline.doc: Enqueue multiple files; returns batch_id and job_ids.
te_po.routes.pipeline.name: enqueue_batch

te_po.routes.pipeline.doc:
Health check for queue system.
    
    In inline mode: Returns 'disabled' (no Redis needed).
    In RQ mode: Checks Redis connectivity and queue lengths.
te_po.routes.pipeline.name: queue_health

te_po.routes.assistant.doc:
Bridge endpoint for assistant tool-calls.
    Accepts either:
    - file_url: URL to fetch file bytes
    - text: inline text to process
te_po.routes.assistant.name: assistant_run

te_po.routes.assistant.doc:
Create an OpenAI Assistant with optional vector store.
    Used by Realm Generator to spin up kaitiaki with their own vector stores.
    
    Payload:
    - name: Assistant name (required)
    - instructions: System instructions (required)
    - model: Model to use (default: gpt-4o)
    - create_vector_store: Whether to create a vector store (default: True)
    - vector_store_name: Name for the vector store
te_po.routes.assistant.name: create_assistant

fields.name: query
fields.description: User query to recall context for.

te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.doc: Extract text from an image via OpenAI vision; optionally persist to vector store.
te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.name: vision_ocr

te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.doc:
Scan DBS cards (front/back), extract metadata, estimate value, and persist to Supabase.
    - Accepts multipart with front/back UploadFile or JSON with URLs.
    - Uses StealthOCR -> parsed metadata -> optional Brave price estimate.
    - Stores raw/process artifacts in Supabase bucket `ocr_cards` and rows in `card_scans`.
te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.name: scan_cards

fields.name: file_url
fields.description: Remote URL with the bytes to OCR

fields.name: prefer_offline
fields.description: Try local OCR before OpenAI vision

te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.doc: Relay Te Ao chat prompts to the configured OpenAI assistant using the Assistants API.
te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.name: ask_kitenga

te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.doc: Free-form text -> OpenAI response with optional retrieval/pipeline/vector persistence. Supports JSON or multipart/form-data with file.
te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.name: gpt_whisper

te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.doc:
Endpoint to execute a pipeline.
    Args:
        pipeline_name: Name of the pipeline to execute.
        input_data: Input data for the pipeline.
        realm_name: Realm in which the pipeline resides.
        verbose: Whether to show detailed logs.
    Returns:
        Pipeline execution results.
te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.name: run_pipeline_endpoint

te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.doc:
Endpoint to query the knowledge base using vector search.
    Args:
        query: The search query string.
        top_k: Number of top results to return.
        min_similarity: Minimum similarity threshold for results.
    Returns:
        A list of matching knowledge base entries.
te_po.routes.kitenga_backend.name: query_knowledge_base

te_po.routes.kitenga_db.doc: Create a log entry in kitenga.logs.
te_po.routes.kitenga_db.name: create_log

te_po.routes.kitenga_db.doc: Get chat history for a session.
te_po.routes.kitenga_db.name: chat_history

te_po.routes.logs.doc: Return the most recent audit events (reverse chronological).
te_po.routes.logs.name: recent_logs

te_po.routes.assistants_meta.doc: Return assistant profile definitions for QA/Ops wiring.
te_po.routes.assistants_meta.name: assistant_profiles

te_po.routes.state.doc: Return recent carving ledger entries from Mauri state.
te_po.routes.state.name: ledger

te_po.routes.state.doc: Return Te Pō state summary from Mauri.
te_po.routes.state.name: state

te_po.routes.state.doc: Fetch the private project state. Protected by BearerAuthMiddleware.
te_po.routes.state.name: get_private_state_endpoint

te_po.routes.documents.doc: Return recent document profiles from local pipeline logs (best-effort) and Supabase metadata if available.
te_po.routes.documents.name: document_profiles

te_po.routes.chat.doc:
Finalize/save a chat session: optional summary, tag, and store in Supabase logs.
    - session_id: chat session identifier
    - title: optional human-friendly title
    - tags: optional comma-separated tags
    - summarize: when true, attempts an OpenAI summary of session context
te_po.routes.chat.name: save_session

te_po.routes.cards.doc: Run OCR on a card photo to extract card details (name, number, rarity).
te_po.routes.cards.name: scan_image

te_po.routes.cards.doc: Aggregate multi-source valuation for a trading card.
te_po.routes.cards.name: estimate_value

te_po.routes.cards.doc: Build a Trade Me-ready row from card metadata.
te_po.routes.cards.name: build_row

te_po.routes.cards.doc:
Build a CSV from a list of card objects.
    groups_of: batch size (default 10) for splitting files client-side.
te_po.routes.cards.name: build_csv

te_po.routes.cards.doc: Lookup card value from reference; fallback to default.
te_po.routes.cards.name: card_value

te_po.routes.cards.doc: Upload a single card image to Supabase storage and return its public URL.
te_po.routes.cards.name: upload_image

te_po.routes.roshi.doc: Vector search over card_context_index. Body: { query: "text" }
te_po.routes.roshi.name: query_card_context

te_po.routes.sell.doc: Log a card for Trade Me CSV output by inserting into cards_for_sale.
te_po.routes.sell.name: add_to_csv

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Wrap message with realm context.
    Adds realm identity, timestamp, and metadata.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: wrap_envelope

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Execute a kaitiaki task.
    Routes to the specified kaitiaki with task details.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: execute_task

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Transfer task between kaitiaki.
    Records context transfer and updates ownership.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: handoff_task

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Semantic search across vector memory.
    Returns documents with similarity scores.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: query_memory

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Store content to vector memory with embedding.
    Assigns tapu level and metadata.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: store_memory

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Log activity to carving log.
    Creates immutable audit trail entry.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: log_activity

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Send notification to recipient.
    Supports multiple channels (Slack, email, realtime).
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: send_notification

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Register a new kaitiaki (guardian agent).
    Stores role, system prompt, and tool definitions.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: register_kaitiaki

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc: Get context (state, capabilities, memory) for a kaitiaki.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: get_kaitiaki_context

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc: List all registered kaitiaki in the system.
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: list_kaitiaki

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Generate embeddings for text.
    Uses configured embedding model (OpenAI).
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: generate_embeddings

te_po.routes.awa_protocol.doc:
Execute a Te Pō pipeline.
    Valid pipelines: ocr, summarise, translate, embed, taonga
te_po.routes.awa_protocol.name: run_pipeline

te_po.routes.llama3.doc: Review code for issues and improvements.
te_po.routes.llama3.name: review_code

te_po.routes.llama3.doc: Analyze an error and suggest solutions.
te_po.routes.llama3.name: analyze_error

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc:
Create a new realm from template
    
    This will:
    1. Create an OpenAI assistant for the realm's kaitiaki
    2. Create a vector store for the realm's knowledge
    3. Copy the project template to /realms/{realm_slug}/
    4. Replace all placeholders with realm-specific values
    5. Generate realm config and README
    6. Initialize git repo (user pushes when ready)

fields.name: realm_name
fields.description: Name of the realm (e.g., Te Wai)

fields.name: kaitiaki_instructions
fields.description: Custom instructions for the AI assistant

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the realm and its purpose

fields.name: template
fields.description: Template type: basic, with-kaitiaki, with-storage, full

fields.name: github_org
fields.description: GitHub organization for suggested repo URL

te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: create_realm

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc: Check if GitHub integration is available
te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: github_status

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc:
List all spawned realms
    
    Returns all realms in the /realms/ directory with their configs
te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: list_all_realms

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc:
Get information about a specific realm
    
    Args:
        realm_slug: The slug identifier for the realm (e.g., te_wai)
te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: get_realm_info

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc:
Get the SQL migration script for a realm's tables
    
    Args:
        realm_slug: The slug identifier for the realm
        kaitiaki_name: Name of the kaitiaki guardian
te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: get_realm_sql

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc:
Get information about the realm template
    
    Returns the template config showing what placeholders and secrets are needed
te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: get_template_info

te_po.routes.realm_generator.doc:
Delete a realm
    
    WARNING: This permanently deletes the realm folder.
    Does NOT delete OpenAI resources (assistant, vector store).
    
    Args:
        realm_slug: The slug identifier for the realm
        confirm: Must be True to actually delete
te_po.routes.realm_generator.name: delete_realm

te_po.routes.cors_manager.doc: List all currently allowed CORS origins.
te_po.routes.cors_manager.name: list_origins

te_po.routes.cors_manager.doc: Add a new CORS origin at runtime.
te_po.routes.cors_manager.name: add_origin

te_po.routes.cors_manager.doc: Remove a CORS origin at runtime.
te_po.routes.cors_manager.name: remove_origin
